p: The aroma profile represents the volatiles spontaneous emitted from the living plants and is a highly complex component of floral phenotype (Raguso, 2008). High intra and inter-specific variations in secondary metabolite production and aroma composition were reported in Lavandula genus, including L. latifolia and L. luisieri (Sanz et al., 2004; Muñoz-Bertomeu et al., 2007; González-Coloma et al., 2011) and other ornamental plants, such as rose, magnolia, and butterfly bush (Azuma et al., 2001; Raguso, 2008; Gong et al., 2014).
